info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.entities.task

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.entities.task.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    @Entity
public class Task
extends Object
implements Serializable
    The Super Class for different types of Task. A Task is the basic module and represents for example a specific activity. By its creation the roles were assigned which indicate who is allowed to fulfil this task. To complete the task only one of these roles is needed. One or more tasks can be assigned to a goal, so depending on the rule of the goal some additional tasks may also have to be completed to fulfill the goal so the player can earn the associated rewards. If the task is tradeable it can be offered in the marketplace, so that another player can do it and gets the reward of it.
    See Also:

      • isTradeable

        public boolean isTradeable()
        Checks if a task is tradeable. This means if a player is allowed to offer it on the marketplace.
        Returns:
        The value it the task is tradeable as boolean.

      • setTradeable

        public void setTradeable(boolean tradable)
        If the tradeable field is set true a task as tradeable, so that it can be offered on the marketplace, if it is set to false the task cannot be traded.
        Parameters:
        tradable - The value (true/false) if the task is tradeable as boolean.

      • belongsTo

        public boolean belongsTo(Organisation organisation)
        Checks if a task belongs to a specific organisation. If the task has the same API key like the organisation the method returns true and the task belongs to this organisation otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        organisation - The organisation which is tested.
        Returns:
        The value if a task belongs to the specific organisation (true) or not (false).

      • completeTask

        public void completeTask(Organisation organisation,
                         Player player,
                         RuleDAO ruleDao,
                         GoalDAO goalDao,
                         PlayerGroupDAO groupDao,
                         LocalDateTime finishedDate)
        If a player completed a task this method adds the task to the list of finished tasks if the player is allowed to complete this task. This is tested by the roles a player has and the roles which are assigned to the task. Also the method tests if the player isn't deactivated because then she/he isn't allowed to complete tasks.
        Parameters:
        organisation - The organisation for that the task was created and belongs to.
        player - The player who completed the task. This parameter must not be null.
        ruleDao - The rule DAO is required to access the created rules.
        goalDao - The goal DAO is required to access created goals.
        groupDao - The group DAO is required to access created groups.
        finishedDate - DateTime when the task has been finished the date time is stored. If the value is null the date is set to now.
